headline.main: Afghans Plunge Into Talks, Differing on Peacekeepers

lead_paragraph: Delegates from the four Afghan factions here began intensive negotiations today over the shape of an interim post-Taliban government. But United Nations officials warned that these talks were not likely to end with a full agreement. A sense of the challenges ahead emerged from a news conference by the head of the Northern Alliance delegation, Yunus Qanooni, who appeared to dismiss any important role for the exiled king, Mohammad Zahir Shah, 87, and said there was ''no need'' for foreign peacekeepers.
abstract: Delegates from four Afghan groups begin intensive talks in Germany on shape of interim post-Taliban government; United Nations officials say talks are unlikely to end with full accord; Yunus Qanooni of Northern Alliance seems to dismiss any important role for exiled king, Mohammad Zahir Shah; sees no need for foreign peacekeepers (M)
